intro: Alysicarpus pylifer, commonly known as the cowpea grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by pods containing edible seeds, which are used in various culinary applications. Alysicarpus pylifer is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in agricultural systems.
